intro: Oenothera hartwegii var. fendleri, commonly known as the Fendler's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a perennial species that often grows in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant's botanical features make it well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native range.
